select_traits_tax_dist()

Source: R/select_traits_tax_dist.R
select_traits_tax_dist.Rd

Get taxonomic distances of target names relative to the taxa databases

Usage

select_traits_tax_dist(
  data,
  target_taxon,
  body_size,
  life_stage,
  max_tax_dist = 3,
  trait = "equation",
  gen_sp_dist = 0.5
)

Arguments

data

  • input data.frame exported from get_habitat_data() and clean_taxon_names() function

target_taxon

  • character string with the column name containing the taxon names

body_size

  • column name containing the body length data

life_stage

  • character string with the column name containing the life-stage information

max_tax_dist

  • maximum taxonomic distance acceptable between the target and the taxa in the database (default = 3)

trait

  • trait to be searched for (default = "equation")

gen_sp_dist

  • taxonomic distance between a genus and a species (default = 0.5)

Value

tibble of the input data with traits or equations within the maximum taxonomic distance

Details

This function searches the relevant trait or equation database for the best matching trait or equation for a given target name based on taxonomic distance

Author

James G. Hagan (james_hagan(at)outlook.com)
